      • LorentzTransformation

        public javax.vecmath.Vector3f LorentzTransformation(javax.vecmath.Vector3f vector,
                                           char axis,
                                           double degree)
        do Lorentz transformation on the given vector.
        Parameters:
        vector - the vector to activate the lorentz transformation
        axis - the axis
        degree - the degree
        Returns:
        the vector3f after lorentz transformation

      • getLorentzUMatrix

        private double[][] getLorentzUMatrix(char axis,
                           double degree)
        Return the U matrix for the Lorentz Transformation, see more on http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lorentz_transformation
        Parameters:
        axis - the char of the axis: 'x' / 'y' / 'z' only (case sensitive) - doesn't matter if dimension set to 2D
        degree - the degree for rotating around the axis. positive side is counter clockwise
        Returns:
        the U matrix for the Lorentz Transformation if the degree is zero the return an empty matrix in size [0][0]. in case of an error returns null

      • matrixMultiply

        private double[][] matrixMultiply(double[][] A,
                        double[][] B)
        Matrix multiply.
        Parameters:
        A - the first Matrix to multiply
        B - the second Matrix to multiply
        Returns:
        the answer for the cross of A x B

      • fixZeros

        private void fixZeros(double[][] matrix)
        Fix zeros. this method round numbers the smallest then 1.0E-10 to zero
        Parameters:
        matrix - the matrix to fix the numbers in it

      • getDirection

        public MonomerDirection getDirection(javax.vecmath.Vector3f v1,
                            javax.vecmath.Vector3f v2,
                            javax.vecmath.Vector3f v3)
        Gets 3 vectors v1,v2,v3 and returns the direction from the v2 to v3 if v2 came right after v1. Support two dimensions only!
        Parameters:
        v1 - first vector.
        v2 - second vector
        v3 - third vector
        Returns:
        direction from v2 to v3.
